title: Exponential and Logarithmic - End Behavior - Part B

content.question: Part B (i) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> decrease without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit. (ii) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> for input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> that are less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math> and sufficiently close to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math>. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

frqParts.text: Part B (i) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> as input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> decrease without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit. (ii) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> for input values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> that are less than <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math> and sufficiently close to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>3</mn> </math>. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
